title-group.article-title: STRONG ORDER OF CONVERGENCE OF A FULLY DISCRETE APPROXIMATION OF A LINEAR STOCHASTIC VOLTERRA TYPE EVOLUTION EQUATION

abstract.p: In this paper we investigate a discrete approximation in time and in space of a Hilbert space valued stochastic process {u(t)}t∈[0, T] satisfying a stochastic linear evolution equation with a positive-type memory term driven by an additive Gaussian noise. The equation can be written in an abstract form as $\mathrm{d}\mathrm{u}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}+\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\left({\int }_{0}^{\mathrm{t}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{b}(\mathrm{t}-\mathrm{s})\mathrm{A}\mathrm{u}\left(\mathrm{s}\right)\mathrm{d}\mathrm{s}\right)\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{d}\mathrm{t}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}=\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{d}{\mathrm{W}}^{\mathrm{Q}},\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{t}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\in \text{\hspace{0.17em}}(0,\mathrm{T}];\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{u}\left(0\right)\text{\hspace{0.17em}}=\text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{u}}_{0}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\in \text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{H}$ where WQ is a Q-Wiener process on H = L²(D) and where the main example of b we consider is given by b(t) = tβ–1/Γ(β), 0 %lt; β %lt; 1. We let A be an unbounded linear self-adjoint positive operator on H and we further assume that there exist α > 0 such that A–α has finite trace and that Q is bounded from H into D(Ak) for some real k with $\mathrm{\alpha }\text{\hspace{0.17em}}-\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\frac{1}{\mathrm{\beta }+1}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}<\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{\kappa }\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\le \text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{\alpha }\text{\hspace{0.17em}}$ The discretization is achieved via an implicit Euler scheme and a Laplace transform convolution quadrature in time (parameter △t = T/n), and a standard continuous finite element method in space (parameter h). Let un,h be the discrete solution at T = n△t. We show that $({{\mathrm{\mathbb{E}}\parallel \mathrm{u}}_{\mathrm{n},\mathrm{h}}-\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{u}\left(\mathrm{T}\right)\parallel }^{2}{)}^{1/2}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}=\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{O}({\mathrm{h}}^{\mathrm{v}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}+\text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{\Delta }\mathrm{t}}^{\mathrm{\gamma }})$, for any $\mathrm{v}\le \frac{1}{\mathrm{\beta }+1}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}-\mathrm{\alpha }\text{\hspace{0.17em}}+\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\mathrm{\kappa }$.
